subsetsum

Class SubsetSum

  • java.lang.Object
    • subsetsum.SubsetSum

  • public class SubsetSum
extends java.lang.Object
    Finds the subset that is as close to the input limit as possible

      • findSubset

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> findSubset(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> masterList,
                                                               java.lang.Double budget)
        passes values into the computeSubset method
        Parameters:
        masterList - is used to be fed into the computeSubset() method
        budget - is used to be fed into the computeSubset() method
        Returns:
        a new ArrayList of Double that has a sum budget as close to the input budget as possible

      • findSubsetOfSongs

        public static java.util.ArrayList<SongEntry> findSubsetOfSongs(java.util.ArrayList<SongEntry> masterList,
                                                               double duration)
        passes values into the computeSubset method
        Parameters:
        masterList - is used to be fed into the computeSubset() method
        duration - is used to be fed into the computeSubset() method
        Returns:
        a new ArrayList of SongEntry that has a sum duration as close to the input duration as possible

      • computeSubset

        public static <T> java.util.ArrayList<T> computeSubset(java.util.ArrayList<T> masterList,
                                                       double limit)
        Main function for computing the new subsets
        Type Parameters:
        T - used as the type of object inside the masterList and the Arraylist being returned also used in the sum() method to show sum how to extract the sum of the items in the subset
        Parameters:
        masterList - the main list of objects used for passing into the sum() method and create list method also used to determine if optimization is on
        limit - used as a param in sum() to check if each of the new subsets fits within the budget
        Returns:
        a new ArrayList of T that has a sum limit as close to the input limit as possible

      • sum

        public static <T> double sum(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list,
                             java.util.ArrayList<T> masterList)
        Uses the masterList to sum all the objects in passed in list
        Type Parameters:
        T - acts as a placeholder for the type of object being passed through the arraylist
        Parameters:
        list - contains a set of Integers acting as indexes to spots in the masterlist
        masterList - contains all the real objects that are used for summing list
        Returns:
        returns a double as the sum of list

      • createSubset

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> createSubset(int integer,
                                                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> baseList)
        Creates a clone of the base Integer ArrayList being passed in, adds a new integer to it, and returns the new list
        Parameters:
        integer - used as the int being added to the baseList
        baseList - used as the list integer is being added to
        Returns:
        returns a new subset of the baseList and the added integer

      • createList

        public static <T> java.util.ArrayList<T> createList(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexList,
                                                    java.util.ArrayList<T> masterList)
        Turns a list of indexes to an ArrayList of the object
        Type Parameters:
        T - acts as a placeholder for the type of object passed into ArrayList
        Parameters:
        indexList - list containing indexes to masterList
        masterList - ArrayList containing objects
        Returns:
        a new Arraylist made up of objects of type T that were specified in indexList

      • checkIfSetIsRelevant

        public static <T> boolean checkIfSetIsRelevant(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> currentSet,
                                               java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> allPossibleSubsets,
                                               java.util.ArrayList<T> masterList)
        Check's if a set of the same value of another set allPossibleSets
        Type Parameters:
        T - used as a placeholder for the type of ArrayList being passed in
        Parameters:
        currentSet - the base set of indexes that you are comparing to the rest of the sets
        allPossibleSubsets - the list of sets of indexes that get compared to base set
        masterList - the set containing your main Objects used for passing into the sum() method to find if 2 sets
        Returns:
        false if the currentSet sum is the same as any of the sums in allPossibleSubsets
